Despite being over a decade old and having outdated graphics, UI and engine; Fallout New Vegas still holds up as one of the best examples of a Fallout game and western RPG. Providing a lived in well realized world for players to immerse themselves in, the care and attention of the development team is readily apparent. Providing consideration for most play styles and in game choices, the game does its best not to let you trap yourself or force you down its limited preset avenues. Still limited by game constraints the ending does boil down to 1 of four primary options like later installments, but the attention to detail for your choices and paths leading to that outcome are greatly appreciated. The DLCs are all enjoyable and worth attention as well.

Well, let me tell y'all 'bout Fallout: New Vegas. It's a darn good addition to the Fallout series, packin' in cowboy tunes and a heap of guns. Now, it's a bit of a bummer you can't ride alongside Victor as your companion; reckon he would've added some real flavor to the journey. The story's alright, but truth be told, I ain't playin' Fallout for no grand tale. What I do wish, though, is they'd thrown in more Low Int dialogue options. That's just my two cents, y'know? Fallout: New Vegas is like a ride through the Wasteland, givin' you the freedom to carve out your own story in that wild and unpredictable world.

This game. A fucking masterpiece. Whether you`re starting off in the Fallout franchise or you`re well on your way, you HAVE to play this game to consider yourself a true Fallout fan. I`m not gonna get into the whole story (although I gladly would) cuz it`s incredibly long but I`ll just say that this game took me almost a year (256 hours) to absolutely complete; siding with every major faction, doing every side quest (including unmarked ones), visiting every location, finding and trying every weapon, completing every DLC (There`s 4 that add a new area, story, enemies, weapons and armor, those being Dead Money, Honest Hearts, Old World Blues and Lonesome Road, and then there`s GRA which adds new guns, ammo types and gun mods and Courier`s Stash which gives you extra starting items) at least twice. So I can say that despite the fact that I long-since finished the Fallout saga, this game will forever live in my heart and memory thanks to all the joy (a bit of frustration too I will admit) and great moments that it`s given me, and I hope that for other people buying this game, it`ll be as meaningful and great as it was for me. After all, we can`t expect god to do all the work in publicitating this old(ish) wonder-of-a-game can we?

Embora herde a problemática (e hilária) engine de Fallout 3 e Oblivion - e junto com ela um combate truncado - Fallout: New Vegas compensa com storytelling e personagens memoráveis, missões em sua maioria complexas e com múltiplas soluções, e sistema que, mesmo um pouco datados, infelizmente nunca voltaram à saga (sistema de reputação, sistema de munições especiais, etc.).

A liberdade fornecida pelo jogo é um de seus pontos mais fortes: ao contrário de Fallout 3 e 4, não existem NPCs "essenciais" que não podem ser mortos, fazendo com que seja possível completar o jogo mesmo que todos os NPCs importantes estejam mortos, algo impossível em outros jogos da série. No completo oposto, New Vegas também pode ser completado (com boa parte de seu conteúdo explorado) sem matar sequer um ser vivo. Essa dualidade demonstra o quão bem o jogo foi construído.

Os dialogos costumam ser bem escritos e relevantes, trazendo questões políticas, sociais e filosóficas, e a motivação para o prosseguimento da história principal supera o sentimentalismo forçado da jornada para o reencontro com uma família que o jogador encontra brevemente no início do jogo, como ocorre no Fallout 3 e 4.

Se um RPG profundo e engajante é o que procura, esse jogo é ideal para você.

One of the best games of all time. No matter how much time you put into this game, there is always something that you had no idea existed right around the corner. The sheer amount of dialogue is absolutely absurd, especially when you factor in that this game was developed in 18 months with nothing given to Obsidian but the assets from fallout 3. Almost every single side quest is amazing, the main story line is incredible, and the expansions truly are some of the best DLC that gaming has ever seen. Playing this game through a 2nd, 3rd or 4th time is like playing an entirely different game. You can build your character exactly the way you want to, with every build having their own strengths and weaknesses which actually do significantly effect the way that you play the game. Siding with different factions will open and close doors that you didn't even know were there, and the rewards for completing quests or simply leveling up are always satisfying and useful. The variety in weapons is near unmatched by any other game, and that statement still holds up in 2023 (at least in my opinion). If you are looking for a game that you can play for hours and hours, then come back to down the road and either start over or pick up right where you left off, this is the one. I beat this game at least 10 times on PS3, and here I am on PC still loving it. Yes, there are quite a few bugs, and the game is not even close to optimized for newer hardware, but the community still supports this game with mods to both fix the bugs the game already has as well as create entirely new quest lines, stories, maps, weapons, characters, and even perks and mechanics that aren't in the original game. I can confidently say without a doubt in my mind that this is my favorite game of all time. If you haven't played this game yet please do not overlook it, you are doing a disservice to yourself.

This game is interesting in that the game at its core is excellent but there are hundreds of little flaws that add up to really sour the quality of this game. Sure, you can download mods to fix that but that doesn't change the fact that there are flaws in the first place. With mods though, the game becomes much easier to appreciate for what it is; a game with brilliant writing, fun quests, a captivating story, a deceptively dynamic map, great atmosphere, and good characters.
Go play this game. That's all I have to say.

The morning passed so quickly, it was time for them to meet
It was 20 past 11 when they walked out in the street
Folks were watching from the windows, everybody held their breath
They knew this handsome ranger was about to meet his death
About to meet his death
There was 40 feet between them when they stopped to make their play
And the swiftness of the ranger is still talked about today
Texas Red had not cleared leather 'fore a bullet fairly ripped
And the ranger's aim was deadly with the big iron on his hip
Big iron on his hip
It was over in a moment and the folks had gathered round
There before them lay the body of the outlaw on the ground
Oh, he might have went on living but he made one fatal slip
When he tried to match the ranger with the big iron on his hip

my favourite game

Certainly one of the best open-world RPGs ever made, with rich worldbuilding, good writing, and opportunities for many varied kinds of character builds. The music and sound design are also excellent, although the graphics and physics are weaker, as is typical for games running on this engine. 

For maximum enjoyment while maintaining a vanilla-like experience, I would highly recommend the Viva New Vegas modpack (https://vivanewvegas.moddinglinked.com/) which helps to fix some of the bugs and other problems that the unmodded version of the game still has.

This game is truly the game of all time for me. 
I haven't installed any mods in this game after 900 hours. Just imagine, 900 hours without mods.... that's crazy. I have formed a habit of quicksaving every darn minute in any game with quicksave because of New Vegas. 

This game got diverse skills and perks which would impact how you play the game. PLUS the skills and perks that you invest could impact the story or dialogue. The diverse skills and perks would also induce replay-ability which how I got 900 hours in the game. The characters in this game is also amazing. Lots of unique characters  with deep stories, and some of them also brings impact to the world in the game. 

I truly would recommend this game to those who wants to get into Fallout series.
